channel.title: Making a webclient
channel.description: Can someone give me a complete tutorial on how to make a client a webclient?

item.title: Making a webclient
item.dc:creator: @PureMachine PureMachine
item.description:
@PureMachine wrote:

This is 0wnz and I still need help here

Read full topic

item.title: Making a webclient
item.dc:creator: @Nets8 Nets8
item.description:
@Nets8 wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:7, topic:182458”][quote author=Nets8 link=topic=244109.msg2061222#msg2061222 date=1203321785]

Upload the .class files to the server, and use this: <applet>server.class</applet> (HTML code).

Err, wtf is that?

<applet code="client.class" width="768" height="520">

I might have gotten the dimensions wrong; didn’t bother looking them up.

But anyway, moparscapers helping moparscapers- priceless.

You don’t make it with client.class (if you’re talking about servers, not clients)…
[/quote]

Why would I be talking about a server inside of a request to make a client applet?[/quote]

Nevermind

Read full topic

item.title: Making a webclient
item.dc:creator: @Nets8 Nets8
item.description:
@Nets8 wrote:

Oops, excuse me. You have to upload the all the .class files in the client. Then you do <applet></applet> with the .class file in the client that has public static void main (String args []) in it.

Read full topic
